text: Ditrigona idaeoides is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1893. Note: This source gives 1892 as the year of description. It is found in Sri Lanka and Sikkim, India. The length of the forewings is 15-16.5 mm for males and 16-17.5 mm for females., 1968: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae). The Transactions of the Zoological Society of London. 31 (4); Abstract: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae) Adults are pure shining white, the forewings with an indistinct subbasal fuscous line. Both wings have two oblique antemedial waved lines and two postmedial lines, angled below the costa of the forewings and bent towards the inner margin of the hindwings. There is a waved submarginal and a fine marginal line. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1893 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Ditrigona idaeoides
